sec.p: One hundred and twenty gram portions of the air-dried samples of flowers, leaves and roots of E. ilicifolius were separately subjected to HD for 3 h in a Clevenger-type apparatus. The essential oils were subsequently dried with anhydrous sodium sulfate; the corresponding oils were isolated in yields at 0.5%, 0.4% and 0.7% (w/w), respectively, and stored at 4°C in the absence of daylight until GC-MS analyses.
